==AltAnalyze Contact Information==

AltAnalyze is developed at the [http://www.gladstone.ucsf.edu/gladstone/site/gweb1/ Gladstone Institutes] and the University of California at San Francisco.
	 
We greatly appreciate your input. If you have questions, comments, or suggestions regarding AltAnalyze, our online materials, or affiliated projects, please feel free to contact us at:
e-mail: [mailto:alt_predictions@googlegroups.com alt_predictions@googlegroups.com] or [mailto:nsalomonis@gmail.com nsalomonis@gmail.com]

For answers to frequently asked questions, [FAQ click here] or see our [http://groups.google.com/group/alt_predictions user forum].

We encourage you to report program bugs to our above e-mail address.

==Reporting Bugs==

While we try to be diligent about fixing bugs as they arise, some problems may still not be addressed. To search for existing issues, please check our [http://groups.google.com/group/alt_predictions user forum] and our [http://code.google.com/p/altanalyze/issues/list issue tracking system]. Many questions can also addressed by searching our [http://code.google.com/p/altanalyze/w/list Wiki].

For new issues, in your report please include:

1) Your Operating System (e.g. Windows Vista, OSX 10.6, 64bit, etc.)

2) The version of the AltAnalyze program (e.g., 1.15), database you are using (e.g., Mus Musculus EnsMart55) and array type (e.g., Affymetrix Exon 1.0).

3) Detailed information about the bug, including the exact circumstances that caused it and any error message that appears. Usually this is contained within a log file contained in the designated results output directory (AltAnalyze_report.log) or in the AltAnalyze program directory.
